list_definition.definition: (with aboutor around) to pass time without doing anything in particular

list_ex_of_english: The utilitarian may argue that everything is imperfect and that half a loaf is better than no bread.
They may reduce supervision costs by instituting group self-monitoring, with employees engaging in 'mutual monitoring' to minimise 'social loafing'.
The recognised average consumption of bread is two loaves per person per week.
I feel that soldiers are much better engaged in using their brains in a political discussion than, possibly, loafing about in a drinking club.
One pair of rats can eat the equivalent of 160 two-pound loaves.
Would it not be nice if there were equal loaves and fishes for people who have suffered longer than others?
Refers to baked loaves which were mass manufactured in the 70s.
All sorts of things are thrown—loaves of bread, food, mattresses, old prams—not merely hideous and disfiguring, but actually a menace to health.
